results.title: Flowers of Rethymnon
results.creator_credit: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Warriors”.
A drama-documentary based on the memoirs of Lewis Lind. Lew Lind was a member of the Australian 2/11 Battalion, 3 Company, who defended Rethymnon in Crete against the German invasion in 1941. Following the German occupation of Crete, Lind was imprisoned in a POW camp from which he escaped with three other soldiers. This film uses interviews with Lind during his return to Crete in the 80s and re-enactments of the wartime experiences of Lind and fellow soldier, Dick Plant, who were sheltered by the Cretans from the Nazis. A notable feature of the program is the archival German newsreel footage on the invasion of Crete.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Tatoulis, Colin South and Media World

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 3
results.brief_description: Volume 3 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The folders contain material relating to the work of Warren Burt and the general Synthetics website. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Past and future
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
A discussion of the ways in which aeroplanes have been developed since the First World War as a pointer to the way they will develop in the future. A brief resume of the development of the warplane from the First to the Second World War, and of the strategic implications of new weapons in modern air war. Atomic and hydrogen bomb experiments; modern defences - fighter, radar, rockets; long range offensive weapons - rockets, carrier forces, V bombers; and lastly, the web of strategic air forces covering a diminished world.

results.title: Eastern victory
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “War in the Air”.
The three further phases of the air war in the Far East (1943-45). First, the air campaign in Burma. Second, the Pacific air actions leading to the bombing of Tokyo; the third, the atomic bomb, the surrender of Japan, and the resumption of air traffic in the Far East.

results.title: Maximum effort
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “War in the Air”.
The beginning of Britain’s strategic air bombardment of Germany, related to its effect on the German war effort, Spring, 1941-Spring 1942. Title music by Sir Arthur Bliss. Music for this film by Malcolm Arnold.
